result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey N Broady was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).
  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Apply 187 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is ordered to be paid joint/several with the co-actors.  To be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines/surcharges.

Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Court waives DNA surcharge and sample.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
AODA assessment and follow through with any teatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victims (K.C. & A.P.) listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residence or the co-actor (D.B.).

supervisions.notes: Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Court waives DNA surcharge and sample.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 1.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
Associated with Charge #3
Associated with Charge #1
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Received and filed in court by the State.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Corey N Broady in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.    

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to counts 1 & 3.
Court finds the Defendant Guilty of both counts 1& 3.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison:  2 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5
Extended Supervision: 6 Months.
187 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 2 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victims (K.C. & A.P.) listed in the criminal complaint or their residence or co-actor (D.B.).


RESTITUTION:  $9,157.86 joint/several with co-actors (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.




Count 3:
Total Prison: 2 Years.
Initial Confinement: 1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  6 Months.
Consecutive to count 1.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 2 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as Count 1.

Costs: $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.



Defendant to be returned to Milwaukee House of Corrections.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
